title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — On a night where offense was a precious commodity, one man authored a masterpiece. Dikembe Mutombo, the Atlanta Hawks’ towering center, delivered a performance for the ages, single-handedly dismantling the Charlotte Hornets in a dominant 103-83 victory.

While guards grappled for traction, Mutombo was an unstoppable force of nature in the paint. He poured in a staggering 42 points, a career-high and a total that defied belief for a player known more for his defensive prowess. Each of his 17 made field goals was a hammer blow to the Hornets’ spirit, a testament to an offensive eruption no one saw coming.

But Mutombo, the league’s reigning Defensive Player of the Year, did not abandon his roots. He completed his historic night with a monstrous 22 rebounds, controlling the glass with an iron will. His presence was a paradox of pure power: an all-time great defender simultaneously having one of the great scoring nights of the season.

The Hawks, wisely, funneled their entire offense through their unleashed giant. Mookie Blaylock facilitated with 14 assists, and Steve Smith added 19 points, but they were supporting actors in the Mutombo show. Charlotte, led by Glen Rice’s 24 points, had no answer. They were simply witnesses to a historic event.

In the annals of the NBA, the final score will read as a comfortable Hawks win. But the story, the one that will be remembered for decades, is of Dikembe Mutombo’s night of unimaginable dominance—a 42-point, 22-rebound tour de force that left an entire arena, and a league, in awe.
